instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message:
Good Day , ive got a A1268 820-3330-B board here. The computer was working fine and the next morning refused to turn on. The green led on charger lights up for about a minute then goes off. The computer wont switch on from power or from battery.

so far ive measured the following.

PPDCIN_G3H - 16.2V
PPBUS_G3H - 12.6V

could anyone please point me in the right direction.

P.S Yes im using 85w charger and yes its the original charger.

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: Does it power from a charged battery? Known good magsafe board? ACOK present?

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: Good Day Duke, does not power from charged battery, yes known good magsafe board. ACOK 2.2V

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: ACOK is too low. Check things around U7000, the usual pins 17/18, 27/28, R7005.

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: No he wants resistance mode measurements. Resistance between 17/18 and 27/28. Also the measurement of R7005 in ohms

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message:
Sorry about that , here goes pin
17/18 - 3 ohms 
27/28 - 20 ohms
R7005 - 20 ohms

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: Check SMC_BC_ACOK again, that 2.2V is not right.

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message:
HI, SMC_BC_ACOK IS 2.3V AT U7000 PIN 14.
At R5393 its 3.4v

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: Is R5393 on the board?

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: No its not.

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: the 3.4v measurement i got by testing pin 1 of r5393.

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: That should be connected to pin 14 of the ISL. So if there is any voltage difference between those points the trace must be bad. Check continuity between those points.

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message:
thanks i will check that, im in a completely different time zone, which means when your awake im asleep and vice versa. Do you perhaps have any other ideas i can try if the trace happens to be good? im currently using another board that does power on to test different points and i also get the low voltage ACOK at pin 14 of ISL. 2.3v/2.4v.

Like i mentioned in my initial posting the computer was working perfectly fine and just died the next morning. No signs of liquid damage and no physical damage either.

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: Good Day, a short update. pin 14 and pin 1 of r5393 are same voltage and the trace is good. So im still stuck with a board with no green or orange LED.

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: So is that same voltage 2.4 or 3.3V now?

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: Good Day 2.4V at both points

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: That is no good. What is resistance to GND on that line? R5087 checked?

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message:
R5087 checked - 469K
resistance to ground on SMC BC ACOK is 737K,ohms

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: Well, the first suspect would be the 6259 at this point and if it all sucks then the SMC.

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: Good Day  Guys, i seem to have screwed up somewhere. After poking around too much i see that PPDCIN_G3H - went from 16v to less than 1v. it jumps between 0.4v and 0.7v constantly. seems like ive lost power to majority of the board. :(

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: Green light still present? 3V42 present?

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: No Green Light, 3v42 not present.

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message: Hope everyone had a good weekend, im still struggling with this board. does anyone have any ideas as to what i can check?

threads.title: 820-3330-B Not powering On
threads.message:
Don't use comment, I don't see them,

Short to GND on 3V42?
